description:
During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey patching of the os module.

NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)


Here's the full trace: http://paste.openstack.org/show/24032/
title: volume attach fails on Hyper-V due to eventlet monkey_patch()

comments.content:
During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey patching of the os module.

NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)


Here's the full trace:

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/15395
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/15337
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/bcf8af965e0fc487d27b703e1bbefee4ab433d18
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit bcf8af965e0fc487d27b703e1bbefee4ab433d18
Author: Alessandro Pilotti <email address hidden>
Date:   Sat Nov 3 20:54:12 2012 +0200

    Fixes volume attach issue on Hyper-V
    
    Fixes Bug: #1074717
    
    During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process
    currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey
    patching of the os module.
    
    NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no
    setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)
    
    The fix consists in avoiding monkey patching the os module in
    nova-compute on Hyper-V
    
    Change-Id: Ib513bc218da83b751439bad114baac24b08e3d02
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
